intro: Utricularia moniliformis, commonly known as the thread bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like stems and tiny bladders used for capturing prey. This species is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish-yellow in color. Utricularia moniliformis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by controlling small invertebrate populations through its predatory mechanism.
